questions.question: 1. What happens to the depletion region in a P-channel JFET when the gate-source voltage (V_GS) is made more positive?
2. In a P-channel JFET, what is the effect of increasing the gate-source voltage (V_GS) beyond the pinch-off voltage (V_P)?

answers.d: Has no effect on drain current (I_D)

questions.question: 3. How does the drain-source voltage (V_DS) affect the drain current (I_D) in the reverse bias condition of a P-channel JFET?

answers.c: I_D remains constant regardless of V_DS

questions.question: 4. In a P-channel JFET, what happens when the gate-source voltage (V_GS) is equal to the pinch-off voltage (V_P)?

answers.a: The device operates in the ohmic region
answers.b: The device operates in the saturation region
answers.c: The device operates in the cutoff region
